alert.note: Alert for Bell; Comanche; Lampasas; Leon; Milam; Mills; Robertson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued February 26 at 6:13AM CST until February 26 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 2 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Wind Advisory, south winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts between 40 to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Comanche, Mills, Lampasas, Bell, Leon, Milam and Robertson Counties. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM CST this morning. For the Wind Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 2 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Unsecured outdoor items may be blown around in the wind. Driving on area roadways may become difficult, especially for high-profile vehicles. Poor driving conditions are expected due to reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wet roads may become slick this morning with the fog. Watch for dangerous crosswinds by evening on west to east oriented roads and highways.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained winds of at least 20 to 30 mph are expected. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Boaters should use extra caution when venturing onto area lakes. Residents may wish to take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other lightweight outdoor objects that may be blown around in the strong winds. A Dense Fog Advisory means visibilities will be reduced to less than one quarter mile. If driving, slow down, use your low-beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between you and the vehicle ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Comanche; Lampasas; Leon; Milam; Mills; Robertson
